title_en: Waffle House raises workers' salaries after strikes and pressure from union organizers
summary_en:
Waffle House raises workers' salaries after pressure from trade union organizations.
The base salary will rise to $3 per hour in June and gradually increase to $5.25 by June 2026.
The increase in wages will be offset by an increase in prices on the menu.
The company also adds bonuses for staying in office and bonuses for working later shifts.
The Southern Service Workers Union held strikes at Waffle House restaurants, demanding higher wages and round-the-clock security.
The group also asked the Ministry of Labor to review the food deductions.
Waffle House has 2,000 restaurants throughout the United States, mostly in the South and Midwest.

title_en: Commuter train chaos due to light rail strike disrupts tram system
summary_en:
Sydney's light rail system will be shut down for a 24-hour strike on Wednesday over union demands for a 23% pay rise and an additional five days of sick leave.
Passengers traveling on the L1 Dulwich Hill, L2 Randwick or L3 Kingsford lines will have to look for alternative routes.
The strike will also affect visitors coming to the Central Business District for a Vibrant festival.
The General Coordinator for Transport in New South Wales has urged commuters to pay attention to the strike and plan their journey.
RTBU members voted to reject the deal, which failed to solve the employees' problems.
Additional buses have been allocated to help students get from the Central Train Station to their campus.

title: –ó–∞–±–∞—Å—Ç–æ–≤–∫–∞ –≤ TEC —Ä–∞—Å–ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω–∏–ª–∞—Å—å –Ω–∞ –≠–Ω–æ –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ –Ω–∞–ø–∞–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è –Ω–∞ –≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç–µ–ª—è –∞–≤—Ç–æ–±—É—Å–∞
title_en: The TEC strike spread to Hainaut after an attack on a bus driver
summary_en:
A bus driver was physically assaulted in the Waterloo area.
The incident occurred on a bus operated by the Keolis transport company at about 18:00.
The dispute began due to the absence or invalidity of a ticket for a passenger with children.
The driver informed the passenger about the toll, after which he punched him in the face.
The 54-year-old driver suffered an eye injury and was declared incapacitated for an initial seven-day period.
Waterloo Police confirmed the intervention and filed charges of assault and battery.
Other Keolis drivers from Genappe, Brain-l'alley and Nivelle decided to hold a strike in anticipation of the results of the meeting with the company's management.
Union representatives condemned the recent verbal attack on a female driver in Braine-le-Comte.

title_en: Employees of the Canadian Border Service Agency have reached a preliminary agreement: the union
summary_en:
More than 9,000 employees of the Canadian Border Protection Agency (CBSA) have reached a preliminary agreement.
The strike was originally scheduled to begin on June 7, but it was postponed after an agreement was reached to extend mediation talks.
The key issues for the negotiations were wage equality with other law enforcement agencies, remote work and pension payments.
The preliminary agreement demonstrates the importance of negotiations to achieve the best possible agreements.
Border guards are crucial to border security, and this preliminary agreement recognizes the importance of this work.
The details of the preliminary deal will be made public after the union shares them with union members.
Council members still need to vote to ratify the agreement.

title: –ú–µ–∂–¥—É –ø–æ–¥–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∫–æ–π –ü–µ—Ç—Ä–æ –∏ –∞–≤—Ç–æ–Ω–æ–º–∏–µ–π –ø—Ä–æ—Ñ—Å–æ—é–∑–æ–≤: Fecode –∏–Ω–∏—Ü–∏–∏—Ä—É–µ—Ç –∑–∞–±–∞—Å—Ç–æ–≤–∫—É –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–∏–≤ –ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤–∞
title_en: Between Petro's support and the autonomy of trade unions: Fecode initiates a strike against the government
summary_en:
Fecode, Colombia's largest trade union, is initiating a strike against the government of Gustavo Petro.
The union supports the president, but refuses to reform education because of the changes proposed by the executive branch.
The changes in the education reform cause dissatisfaction with Fecode, who believes that the project has lost its essence.
Reconciling with the opposition and saving the reform is a difficult task for Fecode.
The union promises to maintain its autonomy and protect the interests of its members, despite the support of the government.
The criticism is not about the substance, but about the implementation of the reform, since the content of the reform was approved by Fecode.
